text: I think the price is q expensive, roasted pork is the usual standard you wld get somewhere outside, with $5.50 price with soup. Not so affordable.. Wld think NTUC downstairs is better, $5.30 with duck and roast pork

usually don’t write reviews but i had this for dinner today and it’s one of the best roast pork rice i’ve had. it’s hard to find a generous portion roast pork rice that isn’t too salty and affordable imo. flavorful and yummy (loved the chili too) maybe the only downside i would say is that it wasn’t crispy (which didn’t really bother me). i was so satisfied and will definitely come back in the future. $5.5

Price is too high. Food is tasty but have to think rice
Imagine paying 17$ for duck leg and pork belly.
I paid 12$ for my duck noodle + charsiew + add meat and look at the amount of duck they are giving

Overall food standard is WAY WAY WAY LOWER as compared to old airport outlet. My mom told me not to try it but I don’t believe. Rice is NOT as fragrant, roasted meat NOT as fragrant.  Only consistent thing is the chilli. What a disappointment and waste of my $7.30

I bought a packet of Char Siew rice to take home, but what I got was disappointing.
Instead of the usual Char Siew pork, it was just a small slab of Char Siew fat
- and no, I’m not exaggerating! It was literally just a chunk of fat,
with a thin layer of roast on top to mask it.

On top of that, the rice was undercooked today, which made the whole meal even worse.

This wasn’t the first time I had an unpleasant experience. The last time I bought their Roast Duck
- it came with some loose pieces of tough, hard meat
- the kind that seems like the stall wanted to discard,
but decided to serve to customers buying their more expensive set meals.

Today was the last straw. I won't be eating from here again.
